    • Constructor Detail

      • KDTDriver

        public KDTDriver(String testFilePath)
          throws com.qualitestgroup.kdt.framework.exceptions.KDTParseException
        Creates a KDTDriver from the given test file. The test file is read, and each test case marked to execute is parsed.
        Parameters:
        testFilePath - The path of the test file to open.
        Throws:
        com.qualitestgroup.kdt.framework.exceptions.KDTParseException - If the test file is unable to be parsed.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Runs the KDTDriver. If no files are passed in, a dialog box will open so that files can be selected.

        Command-line arguments:

        • -name [name] : Sets the name of the automation run. Default is "KDT".
        • -noreport : Prevents the report from being automatically opened when a test is finished.
        • -copyreport {filepath} : Copies the report (excluding screenshots) to another location. File path can be relative or absolute.
        • -copylog {filepath} : Copies the log to another location. File path can be relative or absolute.
        • -copyall {filepath} : Copies the entire report folder (report, debug log, and screenshots). File path can be relative or absolute.
        • -basepath [filepath] : Base folder to copy the log/report to. With this option on, -copylog and -copyreport must either be relative paths or be absent.
        • -timestampcopy : Appends the log file timestamp to the base path folder name. (requires -basepath)
        • -manualmode : Runs KDT in manual mode. Keywords are entered manually and executed one at a time.
        • -validate : Validates the test file(s), without running them.
        • -version : Prints out the revision number the jar was compiled with.
        • -nowriteback : Don't write back test info to the test file.
        • -forcelog [log level] : Forces the log level to a certain value (0-6), overrides the test file.
        • -noscreenshot : Disable screenshots.
        • -halterror : Pauses execution when a keyword errors.
        • -savetemplate : Saves a template of an Excel test file.
        • -norobot : Disables automatic mouse-moving robot.
        • -listkeywords : Lists keywords used in the given test file(s), without running them.
        • -parallel {max number of threads} : Runs tests in parallel. If no thread maximum is given, the default is 5.
        • -grid {server}: Runs tests on a grid server. The server argument is typically of the form http://<server>:<port>/wd/hub. If no server argument is passed, the gridServerUrl property in ApplicationData/KDT-Framework/SeleniumGrid/grid.properties is used.
        • -createjiraonfail : Creates an issue of type Task in Jira on test failure. Uses the configuration given in ApplicationData/KDT-Framework/jira/jira.properties.
        • -noqc : Disables QualityCenter result reporting.
        • -email [address(es)] {subject}: Sends email with the report to the given address, with an optional subject. Specify multiple recipients with a quotes, comma-separated list.
        • -D [app] [keyword] [arg] {value} : Injects the given arg into the given keyword at runtime (in all test files), replacing the argument passed in the data sheet. If no value is given for an arg, then it is removed from the keyword.
        • -help : Prints this message
        Parameters:
        args - Paths of test files to open.
